page.title: 02TOPOGRAPHY OF SPETISBURY
page.content: Sandwiched between the{River Stour} and the disused{Somerset and Dorset {Railway, Spetisbury}has developed from three hamlets into the longest village in Dorset.Most buildings line the main road which runs in the middle of river and railway.The river is crossed by a notable stone bridge.The village hall is part of the old{Priory,}other parts have been converted into houses whose address is still{"St.Monica's Priory". Nuns' gravestones can be seen in the small village garden and a large walled garden remains. There is a village church and school endowed by a former rector,{Dr.Sloper.}The finest building is the former rectory{"John's {House"}now {"Cedar Court" }and used by the minister of the{Evangelical {Chapel.}A former chapel is a dancing school.{Crawford Castle an iron age {hill fort}overlooks the village.
